message:
5 minutes.  Am so excite.

Will try to post anything that'd have an impact on gaming here.
Been all Lion so far.  iOS 5 coming up now, which should be where gamers get interested.
Finally a decent notification system for iOS!
CRIPES.  $29.99 for Lion!!!
YES!  My biggest question answered:  iOS 5 will run on a 3GS.
iMessage, perhaps Apple's answer to BBM. And what if they extended it to OSX.
50m Game Center users vs. 30m Xbox Live.
Not really an awful lot new Game Center wise...
About time…
The new camera features are pretty neat as well.
App data backup to iCloud.  Finally you won't lose your save games when you delete a game.
That's pretty awesome indeed!
I'm still waiting for the penny to drop on the cost of all this. Surely this can't be all totally free...
iCloud storage APIs.  Was hoping for that.  Means your average game will just save directly to the cloud.
No new iPhone announcement, no big surprise there.
iTunes Match. Woah!
Also, nice that the API supports PCs too...
Our Spring, their Autumn
I haven't been following but, in short, will it allow me to sync my phone profile to the cloud and be able to add/delete stuff to/from my phone from any PC?
Awesome. When's this out? Please say tomorrow :) I'm currently in the position of moving permanently from one PC to another and, well, let's just say it kinda makes it hard to not hate Apple :)
*phew*
Well, the big thing here is that you won't need a PC to do those things anymore, but yeah, it'll sync all your stuff across all your devices.
*resurfaces*

My bet is September.

What are the issues with your move, Mark?
Apple's website now updated.  You can watch the keynote, and get info on the new products announced.

Airplay Mirroring, which is part of iOS 5 is moving things into Wee-You territory.
http://www.next-gen.biz/news/ios-5-delivers-wii-u-style-experience
http://www.geekculture.com/joyoftech/joyimages/1551.jpg
